Hearing.intro: <info>[House Hearing, 115 Congress]</info> <info>[From the U.S. Government Publishing Office]</info> <Doc-title>BUSINESS MEETING: COMMITTEE RESOLUTION 115-9: A COMMITTEE RESOLUTION TO ALLOCATE FUNDS FROM THE COMMITTEE RESERVE FUND</Doc-title> <option> ALLOCATE FUNDS FROM THE COMMITTEE RESERVE FUND ======================================================================= HEARING BEFORE THE </option> <committee_name>COMMITTEE ON HOUSE</committee_name> <option> ADMINISTRATION HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES ONE HUNDRED FIFTEENTH CONGRESS SECOND SESSION __________ MARCH 7, 2018 __________ Printed for the use of the Committee on House Administration Available on the Internet: http://www.gpoaccess.gov/congress/house/administration/index.html ______ U.S. GOVERNMENT PUBLISHING OFFICE 32-365 WASHINGTON : 2018 Committee on House Administration GREGG HARPER, Mississippi, Chairman RODNEY DAVIS, Illinois, Vice ROBERT A. BRADY, Pennsylvania, Chairman Ranking Member BARBARA COMSTOCK, Virginia ZOE LOFGREN, California MARK WALKER, North Carolina JAMIE RASKIN, Maryland ADRIAN SMITH, Nebraska BARRY LOUDERMILK, Georgia </option> <Doc-title>BUSINESS MEETING: COMMITTEE RESOLUTION 115-9: A COMMITTEE RESOLUTION TO ALLOCATE FUNDS FROM THE COMMITTEE RESERVE FUND</Doc-title> <paragraph paraId="1" speaker="">Washington, DC.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="2" speaker="">The Committee met, pursuant to call, at 1:07 p.m., in Room 1310, Longworth House Office Building, Hon. Gregg Harper [Chairman of the Committee] presiding.</paragraph> <hearing-info paraId="3" speaker="">Present: Representatives Harper, Davis, Comstock, Loudermilk, and Brady.</hearing-info> <paragraph paraId="4" speaker=""> Staff Present: Sean Moran, Staff Director; Kim Betz, Deputy Staff Director; Cole Felder, Deputy General Counsel; Dan Jarrell, Legislative Clerk; Erin McCracken, Communications Director; Jamie Fleet, Minority Staff Director; and Eddie Flaherty, Minority Chief Clerk. </paragraph> <paragraph paraId="4" speaker=""> The Chairman. I now call to order the Committee on House </paragraph> <paragraph paraId="5" speaker="">Staff Present: Sean Moran, Staff Director; Kim Betz, Deputy Staff Director; Cole Felder, Deputy General Counsel; Dan Jarrell, Legislative Clerk; Erin McCracken, Communications Director; Jamie Fleet, Minority Staff Director; and Eddie Flaherty, Minority Chief Clerk. Administration for today's committee hearing. A quorum is present, so we may proceed.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="6" speaker="">The meeting record will remain open for 5 legislative days so that Members may submit any materials that they wish to be included herein.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="7" speaker="">There is one item on our docket today, Committee Resolution 115-9, a resolution to disburse $200,000 from the Committee's reserve fund to the Foreign Affairs Committee. This disbursement is in response to a request the Committee received from the Chairman of the House Committee on Foreign Affairs. The disbursement will provide resources for the operations to the Tom Lantos Human Rights Commission.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="8" speaker="">I would now like to recognize my colleague and the Committee's Ranking Member, Mr. Brady, for the purpose of providing an opening statement.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="9" speaker=""> [The statement of Chairman Harper follows:] </paragraph> <speaker>Mr. Brady</speaker> <paragraph paraId="10" speaker="Mr. Brady">Mr. Chairman, I have consulted with the minority leadership of the Foreign Affairs Committee, and they are supportive of the request, and so am I. And I urge the Committee to pass this resolution.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="11" speaker="Mr. Brady">And I yield back the balance of my time.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="12" speaker="Mr. Brady"> [The statement of Mr. Brady follows:] </paragraph> <speaker>The Chairman. Thank you, Mr</speaker> <paragraph paraId="13" speaker="The Chairman. Thank you, Mr">Brady.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="14" speaker="The Chairman. Thank you, Mr">Does any other Member wish to be recognized for the purpose of an opening statement?</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="15" speaker="The Chairman. Thank you, Mr">Seeing none, I move the Committee adopt Committee Resolution 115-9. The question is on the motion. All those in favor, signify by saying aye.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="16" speaker="The Chairman. Thank you, Mr">Any opposed, nay.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="17" speaker="The Chairman. Thank you, Mr">Seeing none, unanimously, in the opinion of the Chair, the ayes have it, and the motion is agreed to. Without objection, the motion to reconsider is laid upon the table.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="18" speaker="The Chairman. Thank you, Mr">Does any Member wish to submit supplemental or minority views?</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="19" speaker="The Chairman. Thank you, Mr">Seeing none, for all the matters considered here today, I would ask unanimous consent that the staff be authorized to make technical and conforming changes, if necessary. Without objection, so ordered.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="20" speaker="The Chairman. Thank you, Mr">That concludes today's markup. Without objection, the markup is adjourned.</paragraph>
